qas.question: When did the USB Promoters Group announce the finalization of the USB Power Delivery specification?

answers.text: higher currents and supply voltages from compliant hosts

qas.question: In all cases, both host-to-device and device-to-host configurations are what?

context: <a0_0>In July 2012<a0_0/>, the USB Promoters Group announced the finalization of the USB Power Delivery ("PD") specification, an extension that specifies using certified "PD aware" USB cables with standard USB Type-A and Type-B connectors to deliver increased power (more than 7.5 W) to devices with larger power demand. Devices can request <a1_0>higher currents and supply voltages from compliant hosts<a1_0/> –  up to 2 A at 5 V (for a power consumption of up to 10 W), and optionally up to 3 A or 5 A at either 12 V (36 W or 60 W) or 20 V (60 W or 100 W). In all cases, both host-to-device and device-to-host configurations are <a2_0>supported<a2_0/>.
